channel.title: FindObjectDeformed and FindBitmapToleranceIn
channel.description:
Ok I made the same post in villu, but no one answered so I thought i'd post it here to see if I get any help on this.
Ok, I am new to these procedures and I want to know what would be the best one to use for clicking on a object that is gray. When I used FindObjectDeformed the mouse just moved to the top left of the RS screen and stuck there, and when I used FindBitmapToleranceIn I get a runtime error excess violation of some sort. Now these bitmaps are a very tiny part of the object right? ie: a small gray box taken from the objects picture, or do I need to use a certain bitmap for locating an object. And one more question, when I use these will it repeat itself or do I have to put it in a repeat statement? And if it goes in a repeat statement, would I or would I not have to use MMouse(x,y,5,5).. or does it locate the object with no need of the MMouse. Sorry if these questions are just too nooby but I cant help it, I have been playing around with these procedures all day and its fustrating. ~jR

item.title: FindObjectDeformed and FindBitmapToleranceIn
item.dc:creator: @WT-Fakawi WT-Fakawi
item.description:
@WT-Fakawi wrote:

didnt see your post at villu.

FindBitMapDeformedTolerancedIn is a function that examins the shape of an object aot its color. It is in fact SCAR’s only shape checking algorhythm. If you feed it tolerance and contourtolerance it will set a initial tolerance value. I dont think it loops. The looping you will need to do manual, I think. At least thats what I have done with FindObjectDeformed. Now, this function is only usefull for static objects, like doors, symbols, trees, banks and other static stuff. It is simply too slow for fast moving objects.

Read full topic

item.title: FindObjectDeformed and FindBitmapToleranceIn
item.dc:creator: @junior junior
item.description:
@junior wrote:

The Un-Named:

Runtime errors are often caused randomly. If so, save & close script and try again.

Now I dont have a problem with the runtime errors. I found everything out, but I still need help with these questions.
when I use these will it repeat itself or do I have to put it in a repeat statement? And if it goes in a repeat statement, would I or would I not have to use MMouse(x,y,5,5)… or does it locate the object with no need of the MMouse.

Read full topic
